The '''Abyss Greatsword''' is a [[:Category:Dark Souls: Boss Soul Weapons|boss soul weapon]] and [[Greatswords (Dark Souls)|greatsword]] in ''[[Dark Souls]]''. It was introduced in the ''[[Artorias of the Abyss]]'' DLC.

{{Description
|First paragraph  = This greatsword belonged to Lord Gwyn's Knight Artorias, who fell to the abyss.
|Second paragraph = Swallowed by the Dark with its master, this sword is tainted by the abyss, and now its strength reflects its wielder's humanity.}}

==Availability==
The Abyss Greatsword is created by [[Weapon Modification|ascending]] any [[Standard (Upgrade Path)|Standard]] +10 [[Greatswords (Dark Souls)|greatsword]], [[Ultra Greatswords|ultra greatsword]], [[Straight Swords|straight sword]] (other than the Broken Straight Sword or Straight Sword Hilt) or [[Daggers|dagger]] at the [[Giant Blacksmith]] in [[Anor Londo]] with the [[Soul of Artorias]] and 5,000 [[soul]]s.

==Characteristics==
Compared to its [[Greatsword of Artorias|pristine self]], the Abyss Greatsword has a distinct moveset, lower stat requirements, weighs one unit less, has a heavily deteriorated appearance, and deals purely physical damage. The strong attacks are reminiscent of those performed by [[Knight Artorias|Artorias]] himself.

Despite requiring 18 [[Faith (Dark Souls)|Faith]] and [[Intelligence (Dark Souls)|Intelligence]], the Abyss Greatsword does not scale off of these parameters. This may discourage more specialized builds from utilizing this weapon.

Unusual for a weapon, the Abyss Greatsword has fairly good [[Magic (Damage Type)|magic]] resistance, although most [[Shields|shields]] are still preferable.

Like [[Chaos (Upgrade Path)|Chaos]] weapons, the Abyss Greatsword scales with [[Humanity Mechanic|Humanity]] (up to 10).

==Moveset==
{{Moveset
| 1hWeak   = Horizontal slashes.
| 1hStrong = Fast 720° counter-clockwise swing with high starting lag. May only hit each enemy once per attack, even if they are within reach of both spins.
| 2hWeak   = Vertical swings.
| 2hStrong = Player somersaults into the air before smashing the sword into the ground. High starting and ending lag. Can be parried despite what its airborne appearance suggests.
| Jump     = Player jumps and swings the greatsword into the ground.
| Run      = Spinning clockwise slash.
| Roll     = Quick downward swing.
| Kick     = Standard kick.
| LhWeak   = Block.
| LhStrong = Horizontal swing.
}}
